p: The lithium-ion cells contain prepared alloy as a working electrode with Li reference and LiCoO 2 counter electrodes. The sodium-ion cells contain Na as a reference and Na xCoO 2 as counter electrodes, respectively. The ethylencarbonate/dimethylcarbonate nonaqueous electrolyte, containing Li + or Na + ions were used. The anode and cathode were separated by Celgard 2320 separator (Celgrad, Charlotte, CA, USA) impregnated with an electrolyte.
